text: Thomas Rutherford Brett (October 2, 1931 â€“ February 6, 2021) was an American politician and lawyer. He was a United States District Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Oklahoma from 1979 until 2003, after being nominated by President Jimmy Carter.'Oklahoma Almanac 1997-1998,' Oklahoma Department of Libraries: 1997, Biographical Sketch of Thomas R. Brett, pg. 323 Brett was born in Oklahoma City. Brett died on February 6, 2021 in Tulsa, Oklahoma at the age of 89. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American judges Category:Politicians from Oklahoma City Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Thomas Rutherford Brett
